meanings.definition: To go beyond or exceed in physical distance.
meanings.sent1: The runner overpassed the finish line with a big smile.
meanings.sent2: The bird overpassed the tree and landed on the roof.
meanings.sent3: The snail overpassed the turtle in the race, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her determination overpassed all obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The river overpassed its banks after heavy rain, flooding the fields.

meanings.definition: To surpass or outdo in achievement.
meanings.sent1: She overpassed her own record in the high jump competition.
meanings.sent2: The student overpassed his classmates in the math test.
meanings.sent3: The chef overpassed himself by creating a new delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: His kindness overpassed any other quality he possessed.
meanings.sent5: Their teamwork overpassed all expectations, leading to success.

meanings.sent1: Please do not overpassed the safety guidelines when using the equipment.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overpassed small details, which can lead to mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The teacher accidentally overpassed the student's raised hand during the lesson.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs, he overpassed the potential dangers of the situation.
meanings.sent5: She regretted overpassing the importance of rest until she fell ill.
